result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jairme A. Coleman

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jairme A. Coleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Jairme A. Coleman. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Barth is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jairme A. Coleman appeared with Attorney Michael Robert Barth.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Barth. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:19 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Mike Barth.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on August 3, 2022 at 08:45 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued as previously set.  ts
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22 mailed to the DE

Defendant Jairme A. Coleman in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.   *No Weapons especially firearms.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Emily C, Deondre B, Donesha B, Salina C, Rakeem W, Javontae H and Anna Marie A.

02:09 PM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:45 am.. $10000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). rb
and witness list filed by the State
